content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a two row table, with four columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “t,” and the heading for row 2 is “R of t.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. t is 1. R of t is 1. Column 2. t is 5. R of t is 10. Column 3. t is 8. R of t is 17. Column 4. t is 13. R of t is 32." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>t</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>8</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>13</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>10</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>17</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>32</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The differentiable function <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is increasing, and the graph of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is concave down. Values of <math alttext="R of t " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at selected values of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are given in the table above. The trapezoidal sum <math alttext="open parenthesis, 5 minus 1, close parenthesis, times, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 10 plus 1, and denominator 2, close parenthesis, plus, open parenthesis, 8 minus 5, close parenthesis, times, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 17 plus 10, and denominator 2, close parenthesis, plus, open parenthesis, 13 minus 8, close parenthesis, times, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 17 plus 32, and denominator 2, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>17</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>13</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>17</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>32</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> approximates <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 13, of, R of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: The trapezoidal sum is an underestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 13, of, R of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is increasing.

The trapezoidal sum is an overestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 13, of, R of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is increasing.

The trapezoidal sum is an underestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 13, of, R of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> because the graph of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is concave down.

The trapezoidal sum is an overestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 13, of, R of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> because the graph of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is concave down.

content.answer: The trapezoidal sum is an underestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 13, of, R of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> because the graph of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is concave down.

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
